snippet: Microsoft said Windows 8 was selling at a similar pace to Windows 7, but added that many users were frustrated by changes to the software.
abstract: Microsoft says its Windows 8 software is selling well, but adds that many users are put off by aggressive changes; Microsoft made bold design and functional tweaks to latest operating system, replacing traditional appearance with screen of tiles interface; 100 million licenses for flagship software have been sold since its release, similar to licenses sold for Windows 7 in same period.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said Windows 8 was selling at a similar pace to Windows 7, but added that many users were frustrated by changes to the software.

headline.seo: Solid Sales, but Growing Grumbles, for Windows 8
headline.main: Solid Sales, and Criticism, for Latest Version of Windows
headline.print_headline: Solid Sales, and Criticism, for the Latest Version of Windows
